info.title: Eventbrite
info.description: Create, manage & promote events. Add event-management features to your site. Show the world what exciting things are happening around them.

parameters.name: data-type
parameters.description: xml or json data-types are supported

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: The search keywords. To run an OR search, you need this format: “keywords=google%20OR%20multimedia”. Optional.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Event categories (comma seperated): conference, conventions, entertainment, fundraisers, meetings, other, performances, reunions, sales, seminars, social, sports, tradeshows, travel, religion, fairs, food, music, recreation. Optional.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The venue address. Optional.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: The venue city. Optional.

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: The venue state/province/county/territory depending on the country. 2-letter state code is required for US addresses. Optional.

parameters.name: postal_code
parameters.description: The postal/zip code of the venue. Optional.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: 2-letter country code, according to the ISO 3166 format. Optional.

parameters.name: within
parameters.description: If “within” is set and the “city” or “zipcode” resolve to a specific geolocation, the search will be restricted to the specified within radius. The sorting default will be set to “distance”. Optional.

parameters.name: within_unit
parameters.description: If within is set, you can specify the unit to use: “M” for miles, or “K” for kilometers. By default, the API will use miles. Optional.

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: If “within” is set you can limit your search to wgs84 coordinates (latitude, longitude). Optional.

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: If “within” is set you can limit your search to wgs84 coordinates (latitude, longitude). Optional.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The event start date. Limit the list of results to a date range, specified by a label or by exact dates. Currently supported labels include: “All”, “Future”, “Past”, “Today”, “Yesterday”, “Last Week”, “This Week”, “Next week”, “This Month”, “Next Month” and months by name, e.g. “October”. Exact date ranges take the form “YYYY-MM-DD YYYY-MM-DD”, e.g. “2008-04-25 2008-04-27″. Optional.

parameters.name: date_created
parameters.description: The date range the event was created, specified by a label or by exact dates. Currently supported labels include: “All”, “Future”, “Past”, “Today”, “Yesterday”, “Last Week”, “This Week”, “Next week”, “This Month”, “Next Month” and months by name, e.g. “October”. Exact date ranges take the form “YYYY-MM-DD YYYY-MM-DD”, e.g. “2008-04-25 2008-04-27″. Optional.

parameters.name: date_modified
parameters.description: The date range the event was modified, specified by a label or by exact dates. Currently supported labels include: “All”, “Future”, “Past”, “Today”, “Yesterday”, “Last Week”, “This Week”, “Next week”, “This Month”, “Next Month” and months by name, e.g. “October”. Exact date ranges take the form “YYYY-MM-DD YYYY-MM-DD”, e.g. “2008-04-25 2008-04-27″. Optional.

parameters.name: organizer
parameters.description: The organizer name. Optional.

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: Limit the number of events returned. Maximum limit is 100 events per page. Default is 10. Optional.

parameters.name: count_only
parameters.description: Only return the total number of events (“true” or “false”). Default is “false”. Optional.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Sort the list of events by “id”, “date”, “name”, “city”. The default is “date”. Optional.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Allows for paging through the results of a query. Default is 1. Optional.

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: Returns events with id greater than “since_id” value. Default is 1. Optional.

parameters.name: tracking_link
parameters.description: The tracking link code to add to the event URLs. Optional.

get.description: This method uses our search index to find publicly listed events.

parameters.name: data-type
parameters.description: xml or json data-types are supported

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The ID of the requested event.

get.description: This method returns the data for a given event. Only public events are viewable if no authentication is passed.

parameters.name: data-type
parameters.description: xml or json data-types are supported

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The event title. 255 characters max.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The event description. Optional.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The event start date and time, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., “2007-12-31 23:59:59″).

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The event end date and time, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., “2007-12-31 23:59:59″).

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: The event time zone in relation to GMT (e.g., “GMT+01″, “GMT+02″, “GMT-01″).

parameters.name: privacy
parameters.description: 0 for a private event, 1 for a public event. If not provided, will default to 0. Optional.

parameters.name: personalized_url
parameters.description: The event registration URL. If you pass “testevent”, the event will be accessible at “http://testevent.eventbrite.com”.  This string is limited to 255 characters max. Optional.

parameters.name: venue_id
parameters.description: The event venue ID. The venue must have been previously created using /venue_new. Optional.

parameters.name: organizer_id
parameters.description: The event organizer ID. The organizer must have been previously created using /organizer_new. Optional.

parameters.name: capacity
parameters.description: The maximum number of people who can attend the event. Optional.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: The event currency in ISO 4217 format (e.g., “USD”, “EUR”). Optional.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The event status. Allowed values are “draft”, “live” for new events. If not provided, status will be “draft”, meaning that the event registration page will not be available publicly. Optional.

parameters.name: custom_header
parameters.description: Custom HTML header for your registration page. Optional.

parameters.name: custom_footer
parameters.description: Custom HTML footer for your registration page. Optional.

parameters.name: background_color
parameters.description: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound. Optional.

parameters.name: text_color
parameters.description: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound. Optional.

parameters.name: title_text_color
parameters.description: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound. Optional.

parameters.name: box_background_color
parameters.description: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound. Optional.

parameters.name: box_text_color
parameters.description: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound. Optional.

parameters.name: box_border_color
parameters.description: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound. Optional.

parameters.name: box_header_background_color
parameters.description: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound. Optional.

parameters.name: box_header_text_color
parameters.description: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound. Optional.

get.description: This method creates a new event. It returns the ID of the newly created event.

parameters.name: data-type
parameters.description: xml or json data-types are supported

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The ID of the event to update.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The event title. 255 characters max.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The event description.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The event start date and time, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., “2007-12-31 23:59:59″).

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The event end date and time, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., “2007-12-31 23:59:59″).

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: The event time zone in relation to GMT (e.g., “GMT+01″, “GMT+02″, “GMT-01″) or US Time Zone (“PT”  or “US/Pacific”, “MT”   or “US/Mountain”, “CT”   or “US/Central” or “ET”  or “US/Eastern”).

parameters.name: privacy
parameters.description: 0 for a private event, 1 for a public event.

parameters.name: personalized_url
parameters.description: The event registration URL subdomain.  Your event will be available at http://<personalized_url>.eventbrite.com.  This string is limited to 255 characters max.

parameters.name: venue_id
parameters.description: The event venue ID. The venue must have been previously created using /venue_new.

parameters.name: organizer_id
parameters.description: The event organizer ID. The organizer must have been previously created using /organizer_new.

parameters.name: capacity
parameters.description: The maximum number of people who can attend the event.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: The event currency in ISO 4217 format (e.g., “USD”, “EUR”).

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The event status. Allowed values are “draft”, “live” for new events.

parameters.name: custom_header
parameters.description: Custom HTML header for your registration page.

parameters.name: custom_footer
parameters.description: Custom HTML footer for your registration page.

parameters.name: background_color
parameters.description: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound.

parameters.name: text_color
parameters.description: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound.

parameters.name: title_text_color
parameters.description: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound.

parameters.name: box_background_color
parameters.description: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound.

parameters.name: box_text_color
parameters.description: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound.

parameters.name: box_border_color
parameters.description: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound.

parameters.name: box_header_background_color
parameters.description: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound.

parameters.name: box_header_text_color
parameters.description: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound.

get.description: This method updates an existing event. Only the fields passed as arguments will be modified. This method returns the ID of the modified event.

parameters.name: data-type
parameters.description: xml or json data-types are supported

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The ID of the existing event.

parameters.name: event_name
parameters.description: A new name for this copy of the Event.  255 character limit.

get.description: This method duplicates an existing event, returning the ID of the new event.

parameters.name: data-type
parameters.description: xml or json data-types are supported

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: The user email. Defaults to the authenticated user if not provided. Optional.

parameters.name: do_not_display
parameters.description: Comma separated list without spaces. Valid options include: description, venue, logo, style, organizer, tickets. Example: "do_not_display=venue,logo,style". If you leave this field blank, it will return everything. Optional.

parameters.name: event_statuses
parameters.description: Comma separated list without spaces. Valid options include: live, started, ended. Example: "event_statuses=live,started". If you leave this field blank, it will return everything. Also note that the “ended” option will only return events that have ended in the last 7 days. Optional.

parameters.name: asc_or_desc
parameters.description: Valid options include ‘asc’ or results in ascending order or ‘desc’ or descending order based on event start_date. Defaults to asc. Optional.

get.description: This method lists the events created by this user. Only public events are returned if no authentication is passed.

parameters.name: data-type
parameters.description: xml or json data-types are supported

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The event ID. The event must have been previously created using /event_new.

parameters.name: is_donation
parameters.description: 0 for fixed-price tickets, 1 for donations. 0 will be used by default if not provided. Optional.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The ticket name.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The ticket description. Optional.

parameters.name: price
parameters.description: The ticket price. Enter 0.00 for free tickets. Leave blank for a donation.

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.description: The number of tickets available. Not required for donations.

parameters.name: start_sales
parameters.description: The date and time when ticket sales start, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., “2007-12-31 23:59:59″). Optional.

parameters.name: end_sales
parameters.description: The date and time when ticket sales stop, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., “2007-12-31 23:59:59″). Optional.

parameters.name: include_fee
parameters.description: 0 to add the Eventbrite service fee on top of ticket price, or 1 to include it in the ticket price. 0 will be used by default if not provided. Optional.

parameters.name: min
parameters.description: The minimum number of tickets per order. Optional.

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: The maximum number of tickets per order. Optional.

get.description: This method creates new fixed-price or donation ticket types. It returns the ID of the newly created ticket.

parameters.name: data-type
parameters.description: xml or json data-types are supported

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ticket ID.

parameters.name: is_donation
parameters.description: 0 for fixed-price tickets, 1 for donations.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The ticket name.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The ticket description.

parameters.name: price
parameters.description: The ticket price. Enter 0.00 for free tickets. Leave blank for a donation. If tickets are already sold, price will not change.

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.description: The number of tickets available. Not required for donations.

parameters.name: start_sales
parameters.description: The date and time when ticket sales start, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., “2007-12-31 23:59:59″). Optional.

parameters.name: end_sales
parameters.description: The date and time when ticket sales stop, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., “2007-12-31 23:59:59″). Optional.

parameters.name: include_fee
parameters.description: 0 to add the Eventbrite service fee on top of ticket price, or 1 to include it in the ticket price.

parameters.name: min
parameters.description: The minimum number of tickets per order.

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: The maximum number of tickets per order.

parameters.name: hide
parameters.description: Show or hide the ticket type. Valid options: (y or n)

get.description: This method updates an existing ticket type. Only the fields passed as arguments will be modified. It returns the ID of the updated ticket.

parameters.name: data-type
parameters.description: xml or json data-types are supported

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The ID of the event.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Limit the number of attendees returned. Default limit is 50 attendees per page if paginate selected.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Allows for paging through the results of a query. Default is 1. Page size will be setted with “count” parameter.

parameters.name: do_not_display
parameters.description: Comma separated list without spaces that leaves out certain data returned. Valid options are: profile,answers,address. Optional.

parameters.name: show_full_barcodes
parameters.description: If set to ‘true’, it will return all barcodes associates with the attendee, plus the barcode status, device used, attendee_id, and barcode number. If left blank, it will return a comma separated list of barcodes. Optional.

get.description: This method returns a list of attendees for a given event. If no authentication is passed, only publicly available attendee records will be returned.

parameters.name: data-type
parameters.description: xml or json data-types are supported

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The venue id.

get.description: This method returns a single venue by id.

parameters.name: data-type
parameters.description: xml or json data-types are supported

parameters.name: organizer_id
parameters.description: The ID of the related organizer.

parameters.name: venue
parameters.description: The venue name.

parameters.name: adress
parameters.description: The venue address (line 1). Optional.

parameters.name: adress_2
parameters.description: The venue address (line 2). Optional.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: The venue city. Optional.

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: The venue state/province/county/territory depending on the country. 2-letter state code is required for US addresses.

parameters.name: postal_code
parameters.description: The postal code of the venue. Optional.

parameters.name: country_code
parameters.description: 2-letter country code, according to the ISO 3166 format.

get.description: This method creates a new venue. It returns the ID of the newly created venue.

parameters.name: data-type
parameters.description: xml or json data-types are supported

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The venue ID.

parameters.name: venue
parameters.description: The venue name.

parameters.name: adress
parameters.description: The venue address (line 1).

parameters.name: adress_2
parameters.description: The venue address (line 2).

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: The venue city.

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: The venue state/province/county/territory depending on the country. 2-letter state code is required for US addresses.

parameters.name: postal_code
parameters.description: The postal code of the venue.

parameters.name: country_code
parameters.description: 2-letter country code, according to the ISO 3166 format.

get.description: This method updates an existing venue. Only the fields passed as arguments will be modified. It returns the ID of the updated venue.

parameters.name: data-type
parameters.description: xml or json data-types are supported

get.description: This method lists the venues created by this user. Requires authentication.

parameters.name: data-type
parameters.description: xml or json data-types are supported

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The organizer id.

get.description: This method returns a list of events for a given organizer.

parameters.name: data-type
parameters.description: xml or json data-types are supported

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The organizer profile id.

get.description: This method returns a single organizer by id.

parameters.name: data-type
parameters.description: xml or json data-types are supported

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The organizer name.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The organizer description. Optional.

get.description: Many event creators prefer having a specific person identified as the point of contact for their event. This person is usually someone like the event emcee, or an on-site contact that can help with attendee check-ins or other issues during the event. This method creates a new organizer, and returns the organizer_id for the newly created resource.

parameters.name: data-type
parameters.description: xml or json data-types are supported

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The organizer ID.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The organizer name.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The organizer description.

get.description: This method updates an existing organizer. Only the fields passed as arguments will be modified. It returns the ID of the updated organizer.

parameters.name: data-type
parameters.description: xml or json data-types are supported

get.description: This method lists the organizers created by this user. Requires authentication.

parameters.name: data-type
parameters.description: xml or json data-types are supported

get.description: This method lists the tickets purchased by the authenticated user. Each transaction is an order in our system and an order may contain one or more tickets. Tickets to free events are included.

parameters.name: data-type
parameters.description: xml or json data-types are supported

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The ID of the subuser account. Optional.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: The email address of the subuser account. Optional.

get.description: This method returns the user account identified by the user_id or email request parameters. Visibility is limited to users and sub-users of the given user_key.

parameters.name: data-type
parameters.description: xml or json data-types are supported

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: The user email address.

parameters.name: passwd
parameters.description: The user password. (needs to be at least 4 characters long).

get.description: This method creates a new user, returning the user’s ID in the response.

parameters.name: data-type
parameters.description: xml or json data-types are supported

parameters.name: new_email
parameters.description: New user email address.

parameters.name: new_password
parameters.description: New user password. (needs to be at least 4 characters long).

get.description: This method updates an existing user. Only the fields passed as arguments will be modified. It returns the ID of the updated user.

parameters.name: data-type
parameters.description: xml or json data-types are supported

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the event.

get.description: This method returns a list of discounts for a given event.

parameters.name: data-type
parameters.description: xml or json data-types are supported

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The event ID. The event must have been previously created using /event_new.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The discount code. Spaces, apostrophes and non-alphanumeric characters are not allowed, except for dashes and underscores. Examples: “earlybirdspecial_08″, “membersonly”, “dc121232″.

parameters.name: amount_off
parameters.description: The fixed amount off the ticket price. Each discount code can have a fixed discount amount or a variable (percentage) discount amount, but not both.

parameters.name: percent_off
parameters.description: The percentage off the ticket price. Each discount code can have a fixed discount amount or a variable (percentage) discount amount, but not both.

parameters.name: tickets
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of ticket IDs for which the discount applies. If not provided, the discount will apply to all ticket types.

parameters.name: quantity_available
parameters.description: Maximum number of times this discount can be used. If not provided, no maximum is set.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The discount start date and time, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., “2007-12-31 23:59:59″).

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The discount end date and time, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., “2007-12-31 23:59:59″).

get.description: This method creates a new discount code for a specific event. It returns the ID of the newly created discount code.

parameters.name: data-type
parameters.description: xml or json data-types are supported

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The discount ID to update.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The discount code. Spaces, apostrophes and non-alphanumeric characters are not allowed, except for dashes and underscores. Examples: “earlybirdspecial_08″, “membersonly”, “dc121232″.

parameters.name: amount_off
parameters.description: The fixed amount off the ticket price. Each discount code can have a fixed discount amount or a variable (percentage) discount amount, but not both.

parameters.name: percent_off
parameters.description: The percentage off the ticket price. Each discount code can have a fixed discount amount or a variable (percentage) discount amount, but not both.

parameters.name: tickets
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of ticket IDs for which the discount applies. If not provided, the discount will apply to all ticket types.

parameters.name: quantity_available
parameters.description: Maximum number of times this discount can be used. If not provided, no maximum is set.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The discount start date and time, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., “2007-12-31 23:59:59″).

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The discount end date and time, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., “2007-12-31 23:59:59″).

get.description: This method is used to update an existing discount code. Only the fields passed as arguments will be modified. This method returns the ID of the modified discount code.

parameters.name: data-type
parameters.description: xml or json data-types are supported

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The event ID.

parameters.name: accept_paypal
parameters.description: Accept PayPal payments (1 or 0).

parameters.name: paypal_email
parameters.description: Your PayPal email. Defaults to the user email address if not provided.

parameters.name: accept_google
parameters.description: Accept Google Checkout payments (1 or 0).

parameters.name: google_merchant_id
parameters.description: Google Checkout Merchant ID. Required if accept_google is 1.

parameters.name: google_merchant_key
parameters.description: Google Checkout Merchant Key. Required if accept_google is 1.

parameters.name: accept_check
parameters.description: Accept “Pay by Check” payments (1 or 0).

parameters.name: instructions_check
parameters.description: Instructions to attendees who want to pay by check.

parameters.name: accept_cash
parameters.description: Accept “Pay by Cash” payments (1 or 0).

parameters.name: instructions_cash
parameters.description: Instructions to attendees who want to pay by cash.

parameters.name: accept_invoice
parameters.description: Accept “Send an Invoice” payments (1 or 0).

parameters.name: instructions_invoice
parameters.description: Instructions to attendees who need to be sent an invoice.

get.description: This method creates or updates the payment options for this event. Only the fields passed as arguments will be modified.

info.title: Eventbrite
info.description: Create, manage & promote events. Add event-management features to your site. Show the world what exciting things are happening around them.
